title: How Joe Biden can unleash 'Dark Brandon' and help defeat Donald Trump
content: US President Joe Biden abandoned his reelection bid on Sunday under growing pressure from his fellow Democrats and endorsed Vice President Kamala Harris as the party's candidate to face Republican Donald Trump in the November election. Biden, who at 81 is the oldest person ever to have occupied the Oval Office, said he would remain in the presidency until his term ended on January 20, 2025.
summary: US President Joe Biden abandoned his reelection bid on Sunday under growing pressure from his fellow Democrats and endorsed Vice President Kamala Harris as the party's candidate to face Republican Donald Trump in the November election. Biden, who at 81 is the oldest person ever to have occupied the Oval Office, said he would remain in the presidency until his term ended on January 20, 2025.

title: UAE jails 57 Bangladeshis for protesting against Sheikh Hasina govt
content: A UAE court has sentenced 57 Bangladeshi citizens to lengthy prison terms for protesting against the Sheikh Hasina government over a controversial quota decision. The demonstrations were deemed unauthorized as protests are banned in the Gulf country. The protests, which embroiled Bangladesh in deadly clashes, resulted in the death of over 100 people. Meanwhile, a Bangladeshi student leader on Monday called for a 48-hour halt to the protests against the quota decision.
summary: A UAE court has sentenced 57 Bangladeshi citizens to lengthy prison terms for protesting against the Sheikh Hasina government over a controversial quota decision. The demonstrations were deemed unauthorized as protests are banned in the Gulf country. The protests, which embroiled Bangladesh in deadly clashes, resulted in the death of over 100 people. Meanwhile, a Bangladeshi student leader on Monday called for a 48-hour halt to the protests against the quota decision.

Lotus to Potus: Focus shifting the Kamala's running mate
content: Following Kamala Harris' potential candidacy for president, attention has turned to her possible running mate. Democratic operatives are considering at least six governors, lawmakers, and cabinet officials. Key names include governors Gretchen Whitmer (Michigan), Josh Shapiro (Pennsylvania), and Roy Cooper (North Carolina), along with Gavin Newsom (California), JD Pritzker (Illinois), Andy Beshear (Kentucky), and Transportation Secretary Pete Buttigieg. Arizona Senator Mark Kelly is also a notable contender. Speculative suggestions like Hillary Clinton, Michelle Obama, and Oprah Winfrey are deemed unlikely.
summary: Following Kamala Harris' potential candidacy for president, attention has turned to her possible running mate. Democratic operatives are considering at least six governors, lawmakers, and cabinet officials. Key names include governors Gretchen Whitmer (Michigan), Josh Shapiro (Pennsylvania), and Roy Cooper (North Carolina), along with Gavin Newsom (California), JD Pritzker (Illinois), Andy Beshear (Kentucky), and Transportation Secretary Pete Buttigieg. Arizona Senator Mark Kelly is also a notable contender. Speculative suggestions like Hillary Clinton, Michelle Obama, and Oprah Winfrey are deemed unlikely.

title: Biden drops out: Kamala Harris blooms, says will earn nomination as challengers emerge
content: US Vice President Kamala Harris announced her intention to earn and win the Democratic Party nomination for the presidency, with endorsements from key figures like President Biden, Hillary and Bill Clinton, and Alexandria Ocasio-Cortez. Despite this support, challenges arose from author Marianne Williamson and Senator Joe Manchin. Former President Barack Obama refrained from endorsing Harris, suggesting the possibility of an open convention instead.
summary: US Vice President Kamala Harris announced her intention to earn and win the Democratic Party nomination for the presidency, with endorsements from key figures like President Biden, Hillary and Bill Clinton, and Alexandria Ocasio-Cortez. Despite this support, challenges arose from author Marianne Williamson and Senator Joe Manchin. Former President Barack Obama refrained from endorsing Harris, suggesting the possibility of an open convention instead.

Bye, Done: Biden drops out of race, endorses Kamala
content: President Biden announces withdrawal from 2024 race, citing party and country interests. Endorses Vice President Kamala Harris as nominee. Harris poised to make history as first non-white female and Indian-American candidate. Democratic Party begins process to nominate replacement with Harris as frontrunner.
summary: President Biden announces withdrawal from 2024 race, citing party and country interests. Endorses Vice President Kamala Harris as nominee. Harris poised to make history as first non-white female and Indian-American candidate. Democratic Party begins process to nominate replacement with Harris as frontrunner.
